name: ICNA Council for Social Justice
mission: To systematically facilitate assertive Muslim involvement in the field of human struggle for the rights of the poor and oppressed.
theoryOfChange: Shifting the narrative from solely providing aid to demanding systemic change through policy advocacy, anti-criminalization efforts, and supportive programming.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://icnacsj.org/zakat (Source: https://icnacsj.org/zakat)

score_details.score_summary: Icna Council for Social Justice shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://icnacsj.org/zakat (Source: https://icnacsj.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a Charity Navigator score of 86.5/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 82.6%.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides policies for zakat distribution.
The organization reported total revenue of $834,440 and operates programs focused on Criminal Justice and Immigration.
The charity provides multiple donation options for supporters to fund its social justice mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 70/100 score due to its strong financial health and high alignment with Muslim donor values, though its overall score is tempered by low data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party data availability resulting in a low data confidence score
Need for more detailed public reporting on specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high for Muslim donors as the mission is rooted in religious and cultural urgency, specifically facilitating assertive involvement in social justice [3]. The organization's confirmed zakat-eligible status further strengthens its fit for donors seeking to integrate faith with advocacy [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct provision model through its specialized programs in immigration and criminal justice [3]. While it maintains a high Charity Navigator score of 86.5/100 and a program expense ratio of 82.6%, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data limits the overall impact assessment [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The ICNA Council for Social Justice empowers the Muslim community to systematically advocate for the rights of the poor and oppressed through dedicated social justice programming.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 82.6%, ensuring the majority of funds support direct services
Strong fundraising efficiency with only $0.09 spent to raise every $1
Maintains a solid liquidity position with 7.3 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The ICNA Council for Social Justice focuses on assertive Muslim involvement in human rights struggles, specifically through its Criminal Justice and Immigration programs [3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through its social justice initiatives [2].

all_citations.claim: overall score of 86.86.5/100 from Charity Navigator

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization currently meets 0 out of 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains a strong Charity Navigator score and exceptional program expense ratios, suggesting funds are still being deployed efficiently despite formal policy gaps.

case_against.summary: The primary concern for donors is the lack of verified governance standards, as the charity meets <cite id="1">0/20 BBB standards</cite>, and overall data confidence is low.

confidence.notes: Data confidence is low due to limited transparency and lack of external evaluations.

alignment.explanation: Alignment scores (34/50) are high due to the organization being <cite id="2">verified as zakat-eligible</cite> and its focus on underserved populations within the USA.

credibility.explanation: Credibility is currently limited by a low data confidence score of 0.36. While the organization has an <cite id="1">overall score of 86.86.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, it meets <cite id="1">0/20 BBB standards</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To improve credibility, the organization should work towards meeting BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards and publishing independent audits.

impact.explanation: Impact scores (36/50) are driven by an outstanding <cite id="3">82.6% program expense ratio</cite> and direct provision of services, though hindered by missing cost-per-beneficiary data.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provision rather than grantmaking.

rich_narrative.headline: The ICNA Council for Social Justice empowers the Muslim community to systematically advocate for the rights of the poor and oppressed through dedicated social justice programming.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support domestic social justice initiatives and advocacy within the USA while fulfilling their zakat obligations.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through domestic advocacy
Prioritize organizations with extremely low overhead
Care deeply about civil rights, immigration, and criminal justice reform
giving_considerations: The organization has limited third-party impact evaluations
Governance policies are currently lacking formal BBB certification
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international humanitarian relief or those who require rigorous academic evidence of effectiveness and full BBB accreditation.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that while programs are active, there is limited formal outcome measurement or rigorous evaluation available.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Empowers the Muslim community to advocate for the rights of the poor and oppressed through targeted programs.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact and allows donors to compare cost-effectiveness across interventions.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a relatively small revenue base of $834,440, the organization has significant room to absorb additional funding to expand its domestic programs.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="3">82.6% to program expenses</cite>, maximizing the impact of donor contributions.
The charity spends only <cite id="1">$0.09 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating highly cost-effective fundraising operations.
The organization has demonstrated financial stability with a <cite id="3">22.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The ICNA Council for Social Justice demonstrates remarkable financial efficiency in its operations. By allocating <cite id="3">82.6% to program expenses</cite>, the organization ensures that the vast majority of its <cite id="3">$834,440 in total revenue</cite> is utilized directly for its core mission of social justice advocacy. This is complemented by a highly efficient fundraising model that requires only <cite id="1">$0.09 per $1 raised</cite>, allowing donor funds to stretch further.
rich_narrative.summary: The ICNA Council for Social Justice is an organization dedicated to empowering the Muslim community to systematically advocate for the rights of the poor and oppressed. Operating primarily in the USA, the organization focuses on critical issues such as criminal justice, immigration, hunger, homelessness, and Islamophobia. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="3">$834,440 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. The charity demonstrates exceptional financial efficiency, dedicating <cite id="3">82.6% to program expenses</cite>, ensuring that nearly all contributions directly support its social justice initiatives. Furthermore, the organization is highly efficient in its fundraising efforts, spending only <cite id="1">$0.09 per $1 raised</cite>. Over the past three years, the organization has experienced steady growth, achieving a <cite id="3">22.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. The charity holds an <cite id="1">overall score of 86.86.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting its commitment to accountability and leadership. For Muslim donors, the organization is <cite id="2">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing individuals to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting domestic social justice causes. However, donors should note that the organization currently meets <cite id="1">0/20 BBB standards</cite> and has a low overall data confidence score due to limited third-party impact evaluations.
